subject: Management
title: Delegating Decisions, Not Just Tasks
description: A 60-second lesson on Delegating Decisions, Not Just Tasks.

hook.text: A team lead delegated writing the report but kept every decision about its content. Nothing changed.

buildup.text: Task delegation is 'do this.' Decision delegation is 'figure out and decide what to do.'

discovery.text: Decision delegation is where real empowerment lives. It transfers both work and authority.

twist.text: Most managers delegate labor but hoard decisionsâ€”the exact reverse of what scales.

climax.text: Give the decision, not just the spreadsheet. That's how you build leaders.

punchline.text: Delegate the decision, not just the task.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between task and decision delegation?
options: Decision delegation transfers authority, not just labor
Task delegation is harder to do well
